channel.title: Handheld theme
channel.description: Currently on a Samsung Galaxy S II. When logging in through the mobile theme, it reverts back to the default theme.

item.title: Handheld theme
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“zyle1992, post:4, topic:422520”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=525188.msg3823732#msg3823732 date=1321998040]

I’d just use the normal theme for Smf on mobile. It doesn’t use much time to load anyway. Smf never really fixed all the bugs in their mobile version of their sites.

Pretty sure mitb designed the theme himself…

OT, don’t you just go to profile, change theme etc?
Currently typing on my sensation xe so I’ll check in a minute

Oh, it’s right next to the home button -.-
[/quote]

Yeah. Sorry about being vague last night. I was posting with my phone. It’s more of a cosmetic thing, but when you login (with the mobile theme), it switches back to the default theme. It took me a few minutes to find the mobile theme button (I’m not used to having it there).

Also, the code boxes are a bit off. I think decreasing the font size would be sufficient. (Or maybe my browser is just a POS).[/quote]
I think this actually needs a scrollbar implimented for the mobile theme or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Handheld theme
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:3, topic:422520”][quote author=Andrew Ferguson link=topic=525188.msg3823254#msg3823254 date=1321955442]
I’d just use the normal theme for Smf on mobile. It doesn’t use much time to load anyway. Smf never really fixed all the bugs in their mobile version of their sites.
[/quote]
Pretty sure mitb designed the theme himself…

OT, don’t you just go to profile, change theme etc?
Currently typing on my sensation xe so I’ll check in a minute

Oh, it’s right next to the home button -.-[/quote]

Yeah. Sorry about being vague last night. I was posting with my phone. It’s more of a cosmetic thing, but when you login (with the mobile theme), it switches back to the default theme. It took me a few minutes to find the mobile theme button (I’m not used to having it there).

Also, the code boxes are a bit off. I think decreasing the font size would be sufficient. (Or maybe my browser is just a POS).

Read full topic
